value.string: The eGov universal workflow provides a simple and generic way to track the status, assignments and actions on a request submitted to a governmental administration through a form. It also unifies online form management with digitisation of past data during the transition phase from paper based government to e-government.\r\n A form is first created in draft state and filled either by a citizen or by a civil servant. It is then submitted either for processing or for pending payment. Once payment is done, processing can start. During the whole processing, many workflow transitions might be invoked yet the state of the document does not change. The workflow history provides complete traceability on the validation process. Once all processing and validations are over, the document reaches the closed state and becomes read only.\r\n Additional specific side effects to this workflow must be implemented through interaction workflows if necessary.
